content: What was the significant achievement of the Large Hadron Collider in 2015?

In 2015, the Large Hadron Collider (LHC) achieved a significant milestone by colliding protons at an unprecedented energy of 13 teraelectronvolts (TeV). This energy level was higher than any previously reached in a particle accelerator, allowing physicists to explore new frontiers in high-energy physics. The increased collision energy enabled researchers to search for new particles and phenomena beyond the Standard Model, such as supersymmetry, extra dimensions, and dark matter candidates. This breakthrough marked a new era in particle physics research and held the promise of deepening our understanding of the fundamental building blocks of the universe.
